description: a relation between a 2D immaterial entity (the boundary) and a material entity, in which the boundary delimits the material entity

IAO_0000116: A 2D boundary may have holes and gaps, but it must be a single connected entity, not an aggregate of several disconnected parts.
Although the boundary is two-dimensional, it exists in three-dimensional space and thus has a 3D shape.

label: 2D boundary of
